column4: How do I get ubuntu to start a service at boot-time?  (e.g. httpd, sshd, etc.)
of course you will have to install the correct program to have it kick off when you start the machine
if you want to start or stop a web server with it you will need to install such a webserver
heheh..thanks..  I was aware of that..  I'm switching from fedora core to ubuntu and don't know what translates to what
on fedora, it's configure-services-something or other

it all translates as different, feels similar, but much, much better :-) the most important thing is to get used to sudo - su will ruin your life if you use it (maybe not your life but it could ruin your days
Yeah, I got the sudo speech yesterday
I've been considering a distro change for a while...held off because, well, old habits die hard
I haven't been able to get sudo to work correctly
it says that I'm not entering the write password, when su works fine
bum is really taking a long time to load...is that normal?
how do I fix sudu so that I don't have to su anymore??  when I try to sudo, it says that I have the wrong password when my password is the same
I'm still having problems.  My user is in the admin group and the admin group is in /etc/sudoers and sudo still doesn't work
